intro: Hesperis hygrophylla, commonly known as the wetland scabious, is a flowering plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with cruciform flowers. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Hesperis hygrophylla is adapted to moist environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
